timeline.bodyText: I think you can use StandardCharsets.UTF-8 here, and avoid the exception that could result.
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Using StandardCharsets.UTF_8.toString() seems to still require the exception.
replies.author: williamhu99

replies.bodyText: oh shoot. the API that takes a CharSet is too new to use here.  never mind!
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Ah didn't know this behavior of urlencoder. In that case may want to use guava which I don't think has this problem
https://guava.dev/releases/19.0/api/docs/com/google/common/net/UrlEscapers.html#urlFormParameterEscaper()
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Ah sorry by "this behavior" I meant the inability to round trip space and plus reliably.
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText:
It's the "job" of parseQueryMap to do URL encoding, not this business logic do it there. This is important

if we add more parameters
if someone uses this in their own server instead of the default sun http
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Ah yeah, that encode is redundant.
replies.author: williamhu99

replies.bodyText: Oh wait, the code didn't update (?). The encode should be replaced with a decode.
replies.author: williamhu99

replies.bodyText: Sorry I accidentally commented on the wrong line. I meant the line below - moving decode to parseQueryMap with related unit tests
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.message: Added unit tests for special characters in span names
Moved url decoding to parseQueryMap and updated the corresponding unit tests
